intro: Cladoraphis cyperoides, commonly known as the spiky rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, showcasing its adaptability to moist conditions. Its small, scale-like leaves are arranged in a tight spiral, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cladoraphis cyperoides plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
